chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Donald Leo Konsela Jr. was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine/costs of $3849.00 with $2155.00 stayed under the IDIP Program.  To be paid in installments of $100.00 per month commencing 06-01-2015 and the first of ech month thereafter until paid in full.
AMENDED 10-14-2014:  Defendant revoked from the IDIP Program.

Serve 245 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing immediately.  Under the IDIP Program, defendant to serve 90 days with 155 days stayed upon entrance into and successful completion of the IDIP Program.  After serving the first 48 hours without release, huber privileges granted.  Credit for 3 days served when arrested.
AMENDED 10-14-2014:  Defendant revoked from the IDIP Program.
AMENDED 01-13-2015:  Defendant's huber privileges revoked.

Operating privileges revoked for 36 months.  Under the IDIP Program, operating privileges revoked 24 months with 12 months stayed.  Credit for any administrative suspension.
AMENDED 10-14-2014:  Defendant revoked from the IDIP Program.

Operator's license IID effective date of application.
Vehicle IID effective 45 days from sentence date.
Submit to and comply with an alcohol assessment by the approved public treatment facility and comply with the development of a driver safety plan.  Referred to Arbor Place Inc.

Defendant found IDIP eligible.  Failure to comply with the IDIP Program will result in all stays of the sentence to be lifted.
AMENDED 10-14-2014:  Defendant revoked from IDIP Program.  Sentenced to guidelines.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Leo Konsela Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 15R 001653 - Balance owing paid in full.
Huber privileges revoked.

Defendant Donald Leo Konsela in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to revoke huber privileges cont'd from yesterday.  Court advises defendant of right to an atty.  Defendant wishes to represent himself.  State asking for huber privileges to be revoked, not good time based on huber violations.  Court grants motion, work release revoked.

Defendant Donald Leo Konsela in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to revoke huber.  State informs the court defendant was previously revoked from IDIP and this is his 3rd drinking violation while out on huber.  Court advises defendant of right to an atty.  Defendant wants time to talk with an atty.  MH cont'd to tom.  Notice given to defendant.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on January 12, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Letter from PC District Atty requesting Mr. Konsela's Huber privileges be revoked for the remainder of his sentence based upon the attached information rec'd from PCSD.
Letter from Judge Duvall to Mr. Konsela
Letter from Judge Duvall to IDIP Coordinator advising Mr. Konsela violated his work release & terminated eligibility for IDIP.

Associated with Charge #1 - Original disposition didn't go electronically due to citations that were sent thru electronically were entered incorrectly.
This CSRP includes full penalties as modified in court 10-14-2014.

Defendant Donald Leo Konsela in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court rec'd letter from Pepin County Jail on 2 occasions defendant failed an alcohol test when returning from work release.  Court revokes defendant's eligibility into the IDIP Program.  Sentenced to guidelines, all waivers no longer in effect.  Work release & good time given.

Letter from Pepin County District Attorney regarding PCSD recently informed him that Donald Konsela has violated his huber by consuming alcohol while out on huber release on two separate occasions.  Due to these reasons, the State respectfully requests that Mr. Konsela's huber privileges be revoked for the remainder of his sentence.
Motion hearing on October 14, 2014 at 11:45 am.
Letter from PCSD Huber Officer re: 10/03/14 return from huber release & intox. test results; and 10/11/14 return from huber release & intox. test results.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Letter to Mr. Kauten, IDIP Coordinator re: defendant approved for participation in the IDIP program with copy of draft IDIP agreement.

To be paid in installments of $100.00 per month commencing 06/01/2015 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Failure to make scheduled payments will result in (suspension of drivers license) (warrant).

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Donald Leo Konsela in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge uses complaint for Information, DA to supplment the record with Information.    Judge advises defendant of elements of count 1 & count 3 of complaint/max. penalties.  Judge advises defendant of felony offense prohibitions. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 OWI 4th w/in 5 yrs. & OPAC 4th w/in 5 yrs.  Count 2 dismissed.  Judge advises defendant of his rights.  PLQ/WRF filed with the Court & reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1 OWI 4th w/in 5 yrs. & OPAC 4th w/in 5 yrs.  Defendant found eligible for the IDIP program.  Under the program, penalties reduced.  Clerk not to process sentence until September 19th at 3:00 p.m.   Portion of the sentence stayed according to the IDIP guidelines.  Immediate report to jail at that time.  Appeal rights given.

Defendant Donald Leo Konsela in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to proceed without an Atty.  Files Waiver of Prelim. Hrg., Waiver of Right to Atty, PLQ/Waiver of Rights forms with the Court.  Court advises defendant of Right to Atty., finds defendant K&V waives right to an Atty.  Court advises defendant of right to Preliminary Hrg., reviews Waiver form with defendant.  Court finds defendant waives his right to P.H. and binds him over for trial.
Defendant Donald Leo Konsela not in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant authorized.  Time limits for P.H. stayed.

Adjourned initial appearance on September 8, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 8, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Donald Leo Konsela in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant informs court he decided against Atty representation.  Wants to talk to DA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Donald Leo Konsela in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint filed adding Count 3.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties.  Defendant still looking into hiring an attorney. Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Donald Leo Konsela in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter continued to allow defendant to get an attorney.  P.H. will be taken up at that time.  Bond cont'd.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Donald Leo Konsela in court, in custody.  Jon D Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights including the right to a prelim. hrg.  State requests $2500 Sign. bond with cond:  No possession or consumption of alcohol; no entry into bars or taverns; no operation of motor vehicle w/o appropriate license.  Court sets $2500 Sign. Bond with conditions:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no illegal activity; show up for court dates; no bars or taverns.  Time limits waived for P.H.  Adjourned Initial Appearance 07-01-2014 at 1:30 p.m.
